figures

Class Figure

  • java.lang.Object
    • figures.Figure
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook

    public abstract class Figure
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an abstract super class for each figure. Variables and methods (move() and kill()) are defined here.
    Author:
    Timon Borter

      • move

        public abstract java.lang.Boolean move(int currentX,
                                       int currentY,
                                       int toX,
                                       int toY,
                                       PlayerDatas playerDatas,
                                       Figure[][] figures)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Actualizes data with current game informations, then checks if the step is valid.
        Parameters:
        currentX - The current x-coordinate (which the player selected)
        currentY - The current y-coordinate (which the player selected)
        toX - The selected aim x-coordinate
        toY - The selected aim y-coordinate
        playerDatas - Required the PlayerDatas to check color
        figures - Require actual figures positions
        Returns:
        Returns true if the move is valid
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws null pointer exception for DataBase | Figure[][] == null

      • kill

        public abstract void kill(java.lang.String nameOfPlayer)
        Called if the figure gets slain.
        Parameters:
        nameOfPlayer - Required for JOptionPane.showMessageDialog()
